sage.scene.shape

Class Polyhedron3D

  • java.lang.Object
    • sage.scene.SceneNode
      • sage.scene.Leaf
        • sage.scene.shape.Polyhedron3D
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Teapot

    public class Polyhedron3D
extends Leaf
    Polygon3D is a Leaf with a color and a type. The primary purpose of this class is to support subclasses with differing underlying type structures to take advantage of a common Leaf structure. Allowable types are defined by the set of static final TYPE_xxx strings. Note that unlike most shapes in sage.scene.shape, a Polyhedron3D has no BoundingVolume attached to it by default (although specific subclasses may assign a BoundingVolume).
    Author:
    John Clevenger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Polyhedron3D()
      Constructs a Polygon3D a default name and default values for other parameters as specified by constructor Polyhedron3D(String).
      Polyhedron3D(java.lang.String name)
      Constructs a Polygon3D with the specified name, a default color of Color.white, local translation, rotation, and scale transformations which are Identity, and a default type of TYPE_UNDEFINED.

      • draw

        public void draw(IRenderer renderer)
        Description copied from class: Leaf
        draw() draws the graphical representation of this Leaf. This method is specified by this class (and also by the parent SceneNode class) but must be implemented by any derived classes since the abstract Leaf class can't know how to draw the subclass object. Subclasses are expected to make a "callback" to the specified IRenderer object to draw the object in a graphics API-dependent way.
        Specified by:
        draw in class Leaf
        Parameters:
        renderer - - the IRenderer to be used to draw this Leaf.

      • updateLocalBound

        public void updateLocalBound()
        Description copied from class: Leaf
        updateLocalBound() computes a new local bounding volume for this Leaf by re-examining the vertex data for the leaf. This method is specified by this class (and also by the parent SceneNode class) but must be implemented by any derived classes since the abstract Leaf class can't know what the subclass data looks like (and hence can't know how to compute the bounding volume).
        Specified by:
        updateLocalBound in class Leaf
